required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DEPORRA-CoProst: Assessment of New Fluorescence Imagery Techniques Using Prostate Chips From Transurethral Resections
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of New Fluorescence Imagery Techniques Using Prostate Chips From Transurethral Resections.

collaborator.agency: Clinical Investigation Center, Technological Innovation (Grenoble and Besancon)

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is divided in 4 different steps:
- the first step has two different purpose: assess the impact of the storage medium of fresh prostatic chips on fluorescence signal and adjust the entire chain (immunolabelling,counter-stain and imaging),
- the second step is the adaptation of immunolabelling protocol on histopathology slides, using fresh prostatic tissue,
- the third step is to validate the use of:
1. the medical device created by the FEMTO-ST institute use for the detection of fluorescence signal on fresh tissue,
2. the Light-CT scanner use for tissue structural observation.
- the four step is to check the preservation of morphological structure of tissue under the effect of laser excitation from the medical device.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Results of 5 first patients show that chips' cauterization interferes the signal

primary_outcome.measure: Complete fluorescence measurement over each field of vision.
primary_outcome.description: Determinate for the anti-PSMA antibody with Alexa Fluor 488 tracer, the ideal couple of antibody concentration/incubation time giving the highest immunofluorescent signal in the adjustment of fixed tissue sample protocol to fresh tissue sample protocol.

secondary_outcome.measure: Complete fluorescence measurement over each field of vision.
secondary_outcome.description: Determinate for the anti-PSMA antibody with R-Phycoerythrin tracer, the ideal couple of antibody concentration/incubation time giving the highest immunofluorescent signal in the adjustment of fixed tissue sample protocol to fresh tissue sample protocol.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality criteria of the structure of tissue (ordinal qualitative variables).
secondary_outcome.description: Verification of the preservation of morphological structure of tissue under the effect of laser excitation from the medical device.
Validate the medical device from "FEMTO-ST institute" for the detection of fluorescence signals on fresh prostatic tissue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of prostatic chips tissue architecture between the images from the Light-CT scanner and standard histopathology slides
secondary_outcome.description: Validate the Light-CT scanner from LLTech laboratory in the fresh prostatic tissue structural observation

arm_group.description: All patients undergo a transurethral resection. There are four different steps in the study: the first step: fresh prostatic tissue of 30 subjects will be use to asses the fluorescence signal and the entire chain, the second step: fresh prostatic tissue of 10 subjects will be used to asses the immunolabelling protocol, the third step: fresh prostatic tissue of 20 subjects will be used to asses the use of the FEMTO-ST institute medical device, the four step: the fresh prostatic tissue from the 10 subjects of the second step will be evaluated to verify the preservation of morphological structure with the use of the Light-CT scanner.

intervention.description: All subjects of the study are going to have a trans-urethral resection of prostate.

intervention.intervention_name: Use of the FEMTO-ST institute medical device
intervention.description: The FEMTO-ST institute medical device is use to detect prostatic and malignant tissue.
The Light-CT Scanner is use in the tissue structural observation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male patient over 18 years old.
- Patient scheduled for trans-urethral resection of prostate with:
1. prostate specific antigen (PSA) blood level â‰¤ 4 ng/ml and age > 80 years old
2. a suspected prostate cancer after a digital rectal examination (DRE) and a PSA blood level > 50 ng/ml or an existing prostate cancer
- Patient affiliated to social security or beneficiary of such a regime.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Protected patient referred to in Articles L1121-6 to L1121-8 of the Code of Public Health

facility.name: Grenoble University Hospital, Urology and Anatomopathology Department
